page.title: 15LANCASTER BACKYARDS.
page.content: The North of England has lots of houses that have backyards.They were mostly built about one hundred years ago,at the turn of the century.They are terraced with alleys running in between the rows of houses. The Ridge on the South side of the river has dirtyish yards. Skerton on the other side of the river has cleanish yards. The total number of streets with backyards is 24 the total number of backyards in the streets is 684. 75% of all the houses looked at have backyards. The area of an average yard is 9sq.m. The surface area of all the yards put together is 4070sq.m. On average people have lived in their houses for 19 years. People find their backyards useful for various reasons such as hanging out washing putting dogs and kids in, sheds, and toilets which are useful for old people who can't get upstairs very easily.
